law.catch_line: Transfer Of Funds From Items Appropriated To Joint Legislative Expenses To Items For The House Of Representatives And The Senate
law.text: [ Text of section effective until January 1, 2013. For text effective January 1, 2013, see below.] The speaker of the house of representatives and the president of the senate, acting jointly, may transfer funds, as needed, from the items of appropriation for joint legislative expenses to the items of appropriation for the house of representatives and the senate. Chapter 29: Transfer of funds from items appropriated to joint legislative expenses to items for the house of representatives and the senate [ Text of section as recodified by 2012, 165, Sec. 112 effective January 1, 2013. See 2012, 165, Sec. 137. For text effective until January 1, 2013, see above.] The speaker of the house of representatives and the president of the senate, acting jointly, may transfer funds, as needed, from the items of appropriation for joint legislative expenses to the items of appropriation for the house of representatives and the senate.
